content:
• Wednesday, June 26, 2013
  • MLHR

    More on Herman Miller (NASDAQ:MLHR): FQ4 beats across the board as total sales climb over 9%...

    More on Herman Miller (NASDAQ:MLHR): FQ4 beats across the board as total sales climb over 9% Y/Y. Net earnings rose 97% on stronger-than-expected revenue growth, with new orders up 4% at $461.6M from a year earlier. However, backlog declined 1.3% to $274.4M. For the current quarter, the company forecast per-share earnings of $0.32 to $0.37, well below recent estimates for $0.46. Shares -4.5% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:34 PM
  • PRGS

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: GUNR +16%. PRGS +9%. GORO +5%. DRWI +5%. IAU +4%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: GUNR +16%. PRGS +9%. GORO +5%. DRWI +5%. IAU +4%.
    After-hours top losers: PEI -8%. SIR -6%. YELP -5%. MLHR -4%. PAYX -3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:30 PM
  • EVR

    Investment banking advisory Evercore Partners (NYSE:EVR) is replacing Lufkin Industries...

    Investment banking advisory Evercore Partners (NYSE:EVR) is replacing Lufkin Industries (NASDAQ:LUFK) in the S&P SmallCap 600 after the close of trading on Monday, July 1. A subsidiary of S&P 100 & 500 constituent General Electric (NYSE:GE) is acquiring LUFK in a deal expected to be completed soon. EVR +1% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:26 PM
  • YELP

    Yelp (YELP +12%) skyrocketed to new post-IPO highs today in the absence of major news. Two...

    Yelp (YELP +12%) skyrocketed to new post-IPO highs today in the absence of major news. Two possible triggers: a heavy short interest (14.9% of the float was shorted as of May 31), and the fact the company has often been the subject of M&A speculation. Shares now +85% YTD, aided by a huge jump following the company's Q1 report.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:03 PM
  • HIMX

    Himax (HIMX +11.2%) finishes with a big gain after Chardan Capital argues the LCD driver...

    Himax (HIMX +11.2%) finishes with a big gain after Chardan Capital argues the LCD driver IC/microdisplay vendor's selloff is overdone. The firm notes concerns about Chinese LCD TV subsidy expirations have been pressuring shares (a stock offering also hasn't helped), and does state checks indicate OEMs are paring shipments on expectations of a 2H slowdown. But it doesn't think Himax's Q2 shipments were affected, and thinks (in-line with a Digitimes report) strong Chinese smartphone demand is boosting sales. Chardan believes Q2 revenue could hit the high end of a guidance range for 17%-20% Q/Q growth, putting it above consensus.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:51 PM | 2 Comments
  • BBBY

    More on Bed Bath & Beyond (NASDAQ:BBBY): Q1 comes in line on a per share basis but beats...

    More on Bed Bath & Beyond (NASDAQ:BBBY): Q1 comes in line on a per share basis but beats slightly on the revenue side, as total sales rose 17.8% Y/Y. Looking forward, the company sees its Q2 to be approximately $1.11 to $1.16 per share, and approximately $4.84 to $5.01 for FY13. The Street is looking for Q2 EPS of $1.14 and FY14 EPS of $5.02. Shares -0.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM | 2 Comments
  • PRGS

    Progress Software (NASDAQ:PRGS): FQ2 EPS of $0.27 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $81.7M beats by...

    Progress Software (NASDAQ:PRGS): FQ2 EPS of $0.27 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $81.7M beats by $2.66M. Shares +2.25% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM
  • PAYX

    More on Paychex: Company expects 8%-9% net income growth in FY14. Consensus is for EPS to grow...

    More on Paychex: Company expects 8%-9% net income growth in FY14. Consensus is for EPS to grow 9%. Payroll service revenue grew 4% Y/Y in FQ4, it's expected to grow 3%-4% in FY14. Human Resources Services revenue grew 13%, it's expected to grow 9%-10% in FY14. Funds held for clients rose 3% Y/Y to $4.18B, interest on held funds is expected to drop 7%-9% in FY14. PAYX -2.7% AH. CC tomorrow at 10:30AM ET (webcast). (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM
  • CACI

    CACI International (NYSE:CACI) issues its guidance for FY14, now saying it's looking for an EPS...

    CACI International (NYSE:CACI) issues its guidance for FY14, now saying it's looking for an EPS of $5.70 - $6.10, towards the low end of the Street's $6.08 estimate, on sales of $3.50B - 3.70B. The company also reiterated its FY13 revenue and net income guidance. Shares -1% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM
  • WAB

    Wabtec (WAB +3.5%) ticks higher today after the company's MotivePower unit signs a contract with...

    Wabtec (WAB +3.5%) ticks higher today after the company's MotivePower unit signs a contract with the Massachusetts Bay Transportation Authority to supply 13 additional HSP46 passenger locomotives to be delivered in 2014. The new contract follows previous orders for 27 locomotives and is worth more than $70M including training, manuals and spare parts. The locomotives are manufactured with major components supplied by General Electric's (NYSE:GE) GE Transportation.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM
  • MLHR

    Herman Miller (NASDAQ:MLHR): FQ2 EPS of $0.43 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $460.0M (+9.3% Y/Y)...

    Herman Miller (NASDAQ:MLHR): FQ2 EPS of $0.43 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $460.0M (+9.3% Y/Y) beats by $19.8M. Shares +1.98% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM | 1 Comment
  • CMLP

    UBS is trimming numbers on Inergy (NRGY +1%) from $19 to $16 to reflect current dilution as 2 of...

    UBS is trimming numbers on Inergy (NRGY +1%) from $19 to $16 to reflect current dilution as 2 of 3 steps for its Crestwood (NYSE:CMLP) merger are now complete. The 3rd stage, set for Q3, will fold CMLP into NRGY. The firm alsy lowers FY13 EPS from $0.24 to $0.07 and FY14 EPS from $0.53 to $0.11.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • NTR

    Potash Corp. (POT +2%) will temporarily shut down its six Canadian potash mines this summer for...

    Potash Corp. (POT +2%) will temporarily shut down its six Canadian potash mines this summer for maintenance, some for longer than the regular summer shutdown, a move that may help pare larger than normal stockpiles of the crop nutrient. Stocks of potash at Canadian mines owned by POT, Mosaic (MOS -1.8%) and Agrium (AGU +2.3%) were collectively 20% larger in May than the five-year average.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:50 PM | 1 Comment
  • APOL

    Apollo Group (APOL -9.2%) slumps after its Q3 earnings report shows University of Phoenix...

    Apollo Group (APOL -9.2%) slumps after its Q3 earnings report shows University of Phoenix enrollment and new degreed enrollment fell 17% and 24.5% Y/Y respectively during the period. For their part, Barrington Research believes the company "will continue to disappoint investors as macroeconomic trends and company‐specific issues continue to put pressure on student starts." Across the sector: COCO -1.8%, STRA -2.96%, LOPE -0.41%, LINC -8%, ESI-OLD and EDMC flat.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM
  • IMRS

    Shares of Imris (IMRS +6.8%) pops after the maker of the Visius Surgical Theatre said the Le...

    Shares of Imris (IMRS +6.8%) pops after the maker of the Visius Surgical Theatre said the Le Bonheur Children's Hospital in Memphis, Tennessee was crediting the intraoperative MRI device for reducing returns to the operating room for residual tumor removal by 84% over two years. The Surgical Theatre uses ceiling rails to provide neurosurgeons with real-time structural brain images before, during or after a procedure without moving patients from the surgical table.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:09 PM
  • RAVE

    Pizza Inn (PZZI +8.4%) soars midday on more than four times its average 10-day volume. The...

    Pizza Inn (PZZI +8.4%) soars midday on more than four times its average 10-day volume. The company says it has awarded 15 additional Pie Five franchise units to Florida entrepreneur L. Gale Lemerand who has hired former Carrabbas executive John Tintsman as COO to assist in the expansion of the brand. Lemerand now has a total of 25 Pie Five restaurants in Florida.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:01 PM
  • HON

    Honeywell (HON +2.4%) moves up today after reporting earlier that it's been contracted by PNBV,...

    Honeywell (HON +2.4%) moves up today after reporting earlier that it's been contracted by PNBV, a subsidiary of Petrobras (NYSE:PBR), to supply UOP Separex membrane systems to process natural gas aboard four Floating Production, Storage and Offloading vessels. The company will also will provide ongoing offshore technical support and staff training for the project, which is expected to start up throughout 2016 and 2017.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 PM
  • BLDP

    Ballard Power Systems (BLDP +12.9%) ramps higher today, most likely on the back of President...

    Ballard Power Systems (BLDP +12.9%) ramps higher today, most likely on the back of President Obama's climate change address yesterday. BLDP provides clean energy fuel cell products enabling optimized power systems for a range of applications.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM | 1 Comment
  • SLCA

    U.S. Silica (SLCA +2.9%) is reiterated with a Buy rating and $27 price target at Jefferies after...

    U.S. Silica (SLCA +2.9%) is reiterated with a Buy rating and $27 price target at Jefferies after management "elaborated on momentum and sophistication in its distribution infrastructure and modestly raised its industry demand outlook." The firm says it remains comfortable that SLCA's medium term pricing and margin prospects are healthy.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM
  • RPRX

    Shares of Repros Therapeutics (RPRX +5.4%) have retaken nearly all of the ground they lost...

    Shares of Repros Therapeutics (RPRX +5.4%) have retaken nearly all of the ground they lost Tuesday (post-public offering) and at least one trader doesn't think they will fall hard in the near-term: Over 6K July $15 strike puts were sold this morning against open interest of just ~2.7K.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:31 PM | 1 Comment
  • ALXN

    Alexion Pharmaceuticals (ALXN +5%) ticks higher on reports that its received FDA orphan drug...

    Alexion Pharmaceuticals (ALXN +5%) ticks higher on reports that its received FDA orphan drug designation for eculizumab.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM
  • RAX

    More on Wells Fargo's upgrade of Rackspace (RAX +5.8%): Analyst Gray Powell, who downgraded...

    More on Wells Fargo's upgrade of Rackspace (RAX +5.8%): Analyst Gray Powell, who downgraded Rackspace on April 2 (when shares were at $49.47), says talks suggest fears about the impact of cloud infrastructure services (AWS, Windows Azure, etc.) on Rackspace's hosting ops are excessive. "While cloud computing adoption has had some impact ... All of our contacts stressed that many applications work better in dedicated environments." Powell adds cloud BI software firm GoodData "switched to RAX from AWS because they wanted a standardized platform in public, private, and dedicated environments." Data center colocation giant Equinix (EQIX +2.3%), another firm that depends plenty on traditional hosting, is also outperforming.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:23 PM
  • NBR

    Fitch revises its outlook for Nabors Industries (NBR -1.4%) to Negative while affirming the...

    Fitch revises its outlook for Nabors Industries (NBR -1.4%) to Negative while affirming the drilling contractor's credit rating at BBB, citing a long-term trend of declining market share in the U.S., low utilization on older equipment, industry conditions including a lower average U.S. rig count in 2013, and risks to the rig count from the transition to pad drilling and other higher efficiency operations.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM
  • CQP

    Cheniere Energy Partners (CQP +12.2%) shoots higher, apparently thanks to a plug from Jim...

    Cheniere Energy Partners (CQP +12.2%) shoots higher, apparently thanks to a plug from Jim Cramer, who sees the MLP as the preferred way to play the Sabine Pass liquefied natural gas terminal, believing CQP should be less risky than growth-oriented parent Cheniere Energy (LNG +4.1%). Cramer also likes Cabot Oil &Gas (COG +2%), which he says may have the most prolific acreage in the Marcellus shale.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:08 PM | 10 Comments
  • SPLK

    More on Wedbush's Splunk (SPLK +4.3%) coverage launch: Analyst Steve Koenig expects Splunk to...

    More on Wedbush's Splunk (SPLK +4.3%) coverage launch: Analyst Steve Koenig expects Splunk to "outperform top-line expectations by a significant amount over the next 12 months," thanks to strong customer adds and "the expanded use" of Splunk's products by existing clients - Splunk has been expanding its product line to support security applications, relational databases, and the Hadoop big data framework, among other things. Koenig also points out Splunk has grown its direct quota-carrying sales heads by 70% in the last year, and thinks new reps are now becoming more productive.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:52 PM
  • BWLD

    More on Morgan Stanley's Buffalo Wild Wings (BWLD +3.1%) upgrade: It's all about chicken wing...

    More on Morgan Stanley's Buffalo Wild Wings (BWLD +3.1%) upgrade: It's all about chicken wing costs (i.e. margins) as analyst John Glass notes that for every $0.10 decline in wing prices there is a corresponding 35 basis point expansion for FY operating margins which in turn adds $0.15 to EPS. Add to that the prospect of farmers producing chickens with larger wings and changes to the way customers are charged (weight versus wing count) and you (apparently) have a recipe for success.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:39 PM
  • SRPT

    Baird analyst Brian Skorney weighs in on the Sarepta (SRPT +1.4%) debate today, saying that...

    Baird analyst Brian Skorney weighs in on the Sarepta (SRPT +1.4%) debate today, saying that management is firm on its guidance for a breakthrough designation on Eteplirsen. Skorney notes that SRPT will be deciding on its strategy within the few months. Traders aren't so sure however, as short interest has gone from a low of 1.4% in July 2012, up to 33.5% through the middle of this month, while the average days to cover has jumped to over 10.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM | 3 Comments
  • WMB

    Williams Cos. (WMB +3.1%) shares rise after the owner of the Louisiana chemical plant in last...

    Williams Cos. (WMB +3.1%) shares rise after the owner of the Louisiana chemical plant in last week's fatal explosion says insurance will cover most of the loss. WMB says it has $500M in property damage and business interruption insurance and $610M in liability insurance. The plant would need to be closed until the middle of next year to exceed coverage limits, Tudor Pickering says in upgrading WMB to Hold. WPZ +3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM | 2 Comments
  • WAL

    Another regional banking player which cruised right through the selloff and is hitting a 52-week...

    Another regional banking player which cruised right through the selloff and is hitting a 52-week high today is Western Alliance Bancorporation (WAL +2.2%). Macquarie - which also upgraded M&T Bank today - upgrades Western to Buy from Hold.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:51 PM
  • HOMB

    There's more consolidation in the community bank sector where Home BancShares (HOMB +11.2%)...

    There's more consolidation in the community bank sector where Home BancShares (HOMB +11.2%) agrees to buy Liberty Bank of Arkansas for $250M in Home common stock and $30M in cash. The deal is expected to close in about 3 months. Goldman and RayJay chime in with upgrades on Home to Buy from Hold.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM | 1 Comment
  • RGSE

    Midday top 10 gainers: RSOL +26%. RPTP +18%. HNSN +16%. BLDP +15%. CSIQ +15%. NVTL +13%. JKS...

    Midday top 10 gainers: RSOL +26%. RPTP +18%. HNSN +16%. BLDP +15%. CSIQ +15%. NVTL +13%. JKS +12%. SYNA +11%. OTC:PSTR +11%. HOMB +10%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: CBMX -12%. MG -12%. MEET -12%. FCFS -10%. GORO -10%. SVLC -10%. WLT -9%. FCSC -9%. VIMC -9%. TGD -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • GOLD

    As if gold mining stocks aren't facing enough headwinds today (I, II), Credit Suisse downgrades...

    As if gold mining stocks aren't facing enough headwinds today (I, II), Credit Suisse downgrades Barrick Gold (ABX -6.4%) to Neutral from Outperform with a $20 target, saying ABX needs to provide clarity on the path for Pascua and for handling asset sales and its financial leverage. Also downgraded to Neutral at CS:Silver Wheaton (SLW -5.3%), Pan American Silver (PAAS -1.9%).

     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM | 9 Comments
  • MDR

    McDermott (MDR -1.3%) slips after Goldman Sachs resumes coverage with a tepid Neutral rating and...

    McDermott (MDR -1.3%) slips after Goldman Sachs resumes coverage with a tepid Neutral rating and a $10 price target. Goldman says that despite the uptick in global offshore investment over the near term, MDR is constrained by its shallow water legacy, recent execution struggles, and lack of scale. The company needs to improve on its access, assets, and project execution before the firm feels comfortable recommending investors jump in on the shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM
  • PRXL

    Parexel (PRXL -3.4%) slips after announcing preliminary revenue guidance for FY14 that was below...

    Parexel (PRXL -3.4%) slips after announcing preliminary revenue guidance for FY14 that was below analysts' estimates. It did however, affirm its prior view for the current quarter and current fiscal year. Additonally, the company says it's entered into a note purchase agreement with a select group of institutional investors for $100M in private placement financing. PRXL will sell notes with a seven year bullet maturity and a 3.11% coupon. Proceeds will be used to pay down outstanding debt under its revolving credit facility.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM
  • GFI

    No one has more to lose in gold's bear market than South African miners, as gold drops to as low...

    No one has more to lose in gold's bear market than South African miners, as gold drops to as low as $1,245/oz. and below production and capital spending at Gold Fields (GFI -5.3%), Harmony Gold (HMY -3.9%) and Sibanye Gold (SBGL -9.8%). Labor demands are coming at the wrong time: "There's a vast difference between what labor unions are demanding and what South African mines can afford."
     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM
  • CSIQ

    Canadian Solar (CSIQ +13.5%) skies higher after announcing it's building a solar module/power...

    Canadian Solar (CSIQ +13.5%) skies higher after announcing it's building a solar module/power station manufacturing plant in Ontario in partnership with Samsung Renewable Energy. The plant will create 200 manufacturing jobs by year's end, and supply products for Samsung's Ontario solar projects, including three projects set to create 300MW of capacity. Shares now +198% YTD.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM
  • AEGN

    Aegion (AEGN -1.3%) has sold its 50% interest in Insituform Rohrsanierungstechniken GmbH to the...

    Aegion (AEGN -1.3%) has sold its 50% interest in Insituform Rohrsanierungstechniken GmbH to the Danish company Per Aarsleff A/S, for €14M, or about $18.3M. The company was already jointly owned with Aarsleff. In connection with the sale, Insituform-Germany enters into a product supply agreement with AEGN to purchase on an annual basis at least $3.6M of felt cured-in-place pipe liners during a two-year period from June, 2013 to June, 2015.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM
  • HNSN

    Hansen Medical (HNSN +15.5%) enjoys double-digit gains in morning trading. Earlier, Cowen...

    Hansen Medical (HNSN +15.5%) enjoys double-digit gains in morning trading. Earlier, Cowen initiated the shares with an Outperform rating and a $3 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM
  • RCI

    Canadian mobile carriers Rogers (RCI -8.6%), BCE (BCE -4%), and Telus (TU -7.7%) sell off hard...

    Canadian mobile carriers Rogers (RCI -8.6%), BCE (BCE -4%), and Telus (TU -7.7%) sell off hard after The Globe and Mail reports Verizon has offered ~$700M for second-tier Canadian carrier Wind, is also talking with peer with Moblicity, and is thinking of taking part in upcoming spectrum auctions. Fears about Verizon's impact on incumbent carriers have already been running high.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM | 11 Comments
  • KTOS

    Kratos Defense & Security Solutions (KTOS +2.7%) continues to log more business, saying it's...

    Kratos Defense & Security Solutions (KTOS +2.7%) continues to log more business, saying it's been awarded a contract from a major healthcare and medical equipment provider for high power microwave amplifiers used in oncology therapy systems. The initial award is for more than $6M, with an additional $12M award for service and maintenance of the equipment through 2022. This makes the fourth contract the company's inked this month, for a grand total, so far, of nearly $29M in new business for June (I, II, III).

     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM
  • WDAY

    Workday (WDAY +3.9%) rallies after William Blair starts coverage with an Outperform. The launch...

    Workday (WDAY +3.9%) rallies after William Blair starts coverage with an Outperform. The launch comes a day after partner Salesforce announced a partnership with rival Oracle, and Pac Crest struck an upbeat tone about Workday's new cloud recruiting product. The firm says checks indicate recruiting rivals Taleo and SuccessFactors are "far less competitive" following their respective acquisitions by Oracle (NYSE:ORCL) and SAP, thanks in part major personnel defections (this is an issue bigger software firms often face when acquiring startups), and that Workday's "unique use of object-oriented technology and its proprietary in-memory data model" aid its efforts to enter the HR/finance analytics space.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM
  • CHK

    Chesapeake Energy (CHK +3%) tells a Global Hunter conference it expects to achieve FY 2013...

    Chesapeake Energy (CHK +3%) tells a Global Hunter conference it expects to achieve FY 2013 adjusted net income of $1.09B vs. expectations of ~$1B, sees adjusted EBITDA of $4.92B vs. expectations of ~$5B, and sees total production up 2% Y/Y, Briefing.com reports. Also, a CHK director recently bought 150K-plus shares valued at ~$3M.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM | 1 Comment
  • MYGN

    Myriad Genetics (MYGN +2.4%) gets a boost as Oppenheimer takes up coverage with a Perform...

    Myriad Genetics (MYGN +2.4%) gets a boost as Oppenheimer takes up coverage with a Perform rating. The stock took a big tumble a couple weeks ago, after the Supreme Court ruled to limit gene patents.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:03 AM
  • CPHD

    Cepheid (CPHD +3.4%) moves up today after coverage is resumed at Oppenheimer with an Outperform...

    Cepheid (CPHD +3.4%) moves up today after coverage is resumed at Oppenheimer with an Outperform and a $41 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM
  • SSNLF

    Samsung (OTC:SSNLF) has decided to pull in a new NAND flash memory fab, Cowen reports. SanDisk...

    Samsung (OTC:SSNLF) has decided to pull in a new NAND flash memory fab, Cowen reports. SanDisk (SNDK +1.8%) and Micron (MU +2.5%), whose shares have already rallied on expectations of a favorable memory supply/demand balance, are outperforming today. The opposite holds for some chip equipment makers: AMAT -1.9%. KLAC -0.6%. LRCX -1.5% in spite of BofA/Merrill's 2-notch upgrade to Buy. The firm expects an up cycle in 2014 (Gartner seems to agree), fueled by higher memory spend and the adoption of technologies such as 3D NAND and FinFET (3D) transistors. CLSA upgraded Lam yesterday.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM | 1 Comment
  • MG

    Mistras Group (MG -11.7%) falls lower after announcing it expects FY13 revenue to come in at...

    Mistras Group (MG -11.7%) falls lower after announcing it expects FY13 revenue to come in at $529M, a mark which falls below the consensus estimate of analysts calling for $533.4M. The company says product shipments are below expected levels.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM
  • RPTP

    Raptor Pharmaceutical (RPTP +16%) surges to a new 52-week high today, after the company reported...

    Raptor Pharmaceutical (RPTP +16%) surges to a new 52-week high today, after the company reported late yesterday that the FDA's Office of Orphan Product Development has granted seven-year orphan drug exclusivity for Procysbi delayed-release capsules for the management of nephropathic cystinosis. The exclusivity period began on the date of the drug's initial FDA approval, April 30.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM
  • TDC

    Bullish remarks from Morgan Stanley's Katy Huberty sends Teradata (TDC +6.1%) shooting higher....

    Bullish remarks from Morgan Stanley's Katy Huberty sends Teradata (TDC +6.1%) shooting higher. Huberty, who removed Teradata from MS' best ideas list on April 4 (a month before shares tumbled thanks to a big Q1 miss), says a CIO Survey indicates data warehousing spend is rising again, and thinks the company hit its guidance. Data warehousing rival Informatica (INFA +2.7%) seems to be rallying in sympathy.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM
  • KNDI

    Kandi Technologies (KNDI -7.8%) slips after saying earlier that it's entered into a securities...

    Kandi Technologies (KNDI -7.8%) slips after saying earlier that it's entered into a securities purchase agreement with two institutional investors for a registered direct placement of approximately $26.3M worth of common stock at $6.03 per share. The company will issue a total of 4,376,036 shares to the institutional investors plus warrants to purchase up to 1,750,415 additional shares at an exercise price of $7.24. The warrants have a term of 30 months from the date of issuance. Net proceeds are going to be used for working capital.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM | 2 Comments
  • HTSI

    Shares of Harris Teeter Supermarkets (HTSI +2.5%) spike higher before settling back down as...

    Shares of Harris Teeter Supermarkets (HTSI +2.5%) spike higher before settling back down as chatter picks up that Cerberus will make a bid for the grocery store operator. WSJ's Sharon Terlep tweeted that the publication is working on a story on the potential deal.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:19 AM
  • LXFT

    Luxoft (NYSE:LXFT) posts a strong IPO. After pricing its 4.1M-share offering at $17, the...

    Luxoft (NYSE:LXFT) posts a strong IPO. After pricing its 4.1M-share offering at $17, the Central/Eastern European IT outsourcing firm opened $18.55 and has quickly shot up to $20.24, good for a 19.1% gain. That gives the company a valuation of $660M, or 2.1x FY13 (ended March '13) sales and 18x earnings. Luxoft, which competes with fellow European outsourcing firm EPAM (EPAM +0.3%), received 46% of its FY13 sales from European clients, and 42% from North American clients. The company is a unit of Russia's IBS Group, which still owns 82.9% of voting rights. (F-1)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM
  • FIX

    Comfort Systems (FIX +3.5%) rallies as KeyBanc upgrades the shares to Buy from Hold (price...

    Comfort Systems (FIX +3.5%) rallies as KeyBanc upgrades the shares to Buy from Hold (price target, $18) citing the company's position in "the early stages of the non-residential growth cycle." Analyst Tahira Afzal also notes that the stock could have significantly more upside (to $26/share) based on "its pure leverage to the nonresidential space."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM
  • MOS

    Mosaic's (MOS -3.8%) inability to reach a deal with Cargill shareholders to allow share...

    Mosaic's (MOS -3.8%) inability to reach a deal with Cargill shareholders to allow share repurchases is viewed as a "modest disappointment" by Goldman Sachs, but the firm sees a buyback as a question of "timing, not ultimate magnitude."     Pandora (NYSE:P) +4.1%, adding to yesterday's gains (I, II), after The Verge's Greg Sandoval reports the company is talking to both music labels and artist groups about resolving royalty disputes. The report comes shortly after Pink Floyd penned an op-ed in USA Today attacking Pandora's attempts to lower rates, and less than a month after Pandora bought a radio station in an effort to lower a portion of its royalties. Pandora paid $0.11/stream last year, and is set to pay $0.13/stream next year and $0.14/stream in 2015. Content acquisition costs made up 66% of FQ1 revenue. Sirius XM's (NASDAQ:SIRI) music costs, by comparison, made up just 7.5% of its 2012 revenue.
